intro: Paepalanthus caparoensis, commonly known as the Caparoensis puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, spiky inflorescences that bear small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
